title: Vice-Versa Tech
description: A) 2-3 Sample Videos, B) UI mock-ups for a low-barrier / easy to launch website w/ open source tools, C) Draft plan for a 2016-2017 school year program w/ opportunities for teachers and students.

title: Digital Corps
description: Building a Digital Corps in Chicago: leveraging Hive Network resources to provide Digital Media and Web Literacy support in Chicago schools.

title: Update: Connecting Teachers (Session 1)
description: We will review what we've done so far in terms of connecting teachers to Hive with the idea of pushing forward to figure out ways to credential teachers in Connected Learning
facilitator1: Germania Solorzano, NEIU Center for College Access and Success

title: Update: Connecting Teachers (Sessoion 2)
description: We will review what we've done so far in terms of connecting teachers to Hive with the idea of pushing forward to figure out ways to credential teachers in Connected Learning
facilitator1: Germania Solorzano, NEIU Center for College Access and Success

title: Hive Dictionary (Session 1)
description: Help co-create the first Hive Dictionary.

title: Hive Dictionary (Session 2)
description: Help co-create the first Hive Dictionary.

title: Measuring Impact
description: Conversations and workshops: Quality vs Quantity; How do you measure soft skills? Creating Surveys and forms; Data gathering and assessment; What does impact mean?; Removing the fear of evaluation

title: Using Social Network Analysis (Session 1)
description: People that attend this workshop will learn how to design a program evaluation that incorporates analysis of social networks and social capital.

title: Using Social Network Analysis (Session 2)
description: People that attend this workshop will learn how to design a program evaluation that incorporates analysis of social networks and social capital.

title: Web Literacy (Session 1)
description: Feedback on Web Literacy 2.0, curriculum, training, and credentials Bundle

title: Web Literacy (Session 2)
description: Feedback on Web Literacy 2.0, curriculum, training, and credentials Bundle

title: Grant Writing 101
description: A person who attends the workshop would learn how to write a grant application including improved measures and outcomes.

title: Feedback Mechanisms
description: How to use common physical objects and open source code to create interactive experiences for obtaining teen feedback

title: Ecosystem Apps with HIPC-II
description: Possibilities include mapping parent and community networks, developing a toolkit for program providers to empower parents to engage in kids' informal learning.

title: Youth-Lead Solutions
description: Idea from Youth Friday Hack event to be worked through on Saturday

title: Effective Adult Allies
description: Adult Ally workshop--how to be successful with engaging youth in your org/institution's decisionmaking processes//scaling youth voice into your work

title: Hacking for Data Visualization
description: Create/modify javascript/python code for data collection/visualization; create public site for visualization; define processes for curating data by data moonshot group

title: Facilitating Transportation
description: A user experience demo/runthrough for version 1.0 of RideW/Me, a point-to-point, peer-to-peer transportation solution for Chicago's youth and prep for user testing this Spring for futher development.

title: Schuber
description: Schuber

title: CTA Survival Tools (Session 1)
description: How to use existing digital, analog, and common sense survival tools to navigate  Chicago's public transportation system. This includes CTA Transit Tracker, paper maps, and personal safety tips.

title: CTA Survival Tools (Session 2)
description: How to use existing digital, analog, and common sense survival tools to navigate  Chicago's public transportation system. This includes CTA Transit Tracker, paper maps, and personal safety tips.

title: Safe Bike Transportation (Session 1)
description: Educators will be given the tools engage youth in bicycle advocacy as a vehicle to improve their bicycle transportation options. The presentation will explore the transformative power of bicycles and the role of bicycle equity.
facilitator1: Olatunji Oboi Reed, Slow Roll Chicago

title: Safe Bike Transportation (Session 2)
description: Educators will be given the tools engage youth in bicycle advocacy as a vehicle to improve their bicycle transportation options. The presentation will explore the transformative power of bicycles and the role of bicycle equity.
facilitator1: Olatunji Oboi Reed, Slow Roll Chicago

title: Connecting Opportunities
description: Design a web platform that can connect youth who were not accepted into a competitive, space-limited program, with alternative program opportunities.
facilitator1: Robin Schnur, The Art Institute of Chicago

title: Sharing Events
description: We will demo the HIPC-II RSS WordPress plug-in to aggregate youth events across blogs through a hands-on activity that experiments with community blogging.

title: Build a Sky Camera
description: Someone who attends this workshop will get a better understanding of the importance of the affects on light pollution.  They will learn how to build a sky camera and use it to view the night sky.

title: Mapping Assets
description: Some of the most complex questions of access and opportunity can be easily communicated in a 2-D projection of a place. We'll use map tools to help groups connect w/communities hyper-locally.
facilitator3: David Bild, Chicago Academy of Sciences

title: Community Communications
description: Session will build on the morning's workshop to prototype solutions to online community communications

title: Supporting Collaboration (Session 1)
description: Skillshare participants will learn about the needs of HIVE members in between meetups by looking at the dynamics of an online community built specifically for HIVE members beyond the Slack interim solution.

title: Supporting Collaboration (Session 2)
description: Skillshare participants will learn about the needs of HIVE members in between meetups by looking at the dynamics of an online community built specifically for HIVE members beyond the Slack interim solution.

title: Open Studio Time for Youth
description: Project design & planning skills - move the needle on projects & opportunities by implementing these skills- begin identifying stakeholders, resources, possible collaborations and action steps.

title: Credentialling Connected Leaders
description: Buiding on the morning session.  Continued brainstorming, video interviewing, and curriculum mapping
facilitator1: Germania Solorzano, NEIU Center for College Access and Success

title: Registration
description: Please arrive before 5:00pm to register and grab a refreshment before speakers begin!

title: Keynotes
description: Sam Dyson is joined by Andrea Sa√©nz, Chicago Public Library and Gabrielle Lyon, Architecture Foundation, to introduce you to what the Hive is all about and how we will active and co-create solutions to transform the learning landscape of Chicago.

title: Showcase: Featured Projects from 2015
description: Connect with Hive network members and staff to deep dive on the projects and intiatives that made 2015 a breakout year. Use this time to learn more about what you can do on Saturday, or throughout 2016 with Hive Chicago.

title: Registration
description: Please arrive before 8:30am to register and grab some breakfast before the day begins!

title: Welcome
description: Hive staff welcome attendees and review the agenda and goals for the hack day.

title: Grab 'N Go Lunch
description: Lunch boxes will be available for everyone with a lunch ticket. Grab your lunch box and return to your working group session, or sneak a quick break.

title: Closing Ceremony
description: Stick around to share what your group accomplished today, hear from other groups and what they did, and pledge to take the next steps at meetups in 2016 and beyond.

title: Building Healthy Partnerships
description: Participants will review and test the tools built to support Healthy Hive Partnerships and spend time brainstorming how best to develop a web-based tool that will support partnerships in 2016 and beyond.
facilitator1: Jia Lok Pratt, Consultant on Hive Healthy Partnerships
facilitator2: Adrienne Scherenzel-Curry, Chief Program Officer, After School Matters
